snippet: As fighting continued throughout Syria, the rebels insisted that their hostages were members of Iran’s elite Revolutionary Guards, not religious pilgrims.
abstract: Group of Syrian rebels takes responsibility for the kidnapping of 48 Iranians in Damascus, but the rebels insist that their captives are members of Iran’s elite Revolutionary Guards, not religious pilgrims, as Iran’s official news agency had reported.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Aleppo, Syria, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As fighting continued throughout Syria, the rebels insisted that their hostages were members of Iran’s elite Revolutionary Guards, not religious pilgrims.

headline.seo: Syria Rebels Say 48 Iran Captives are Revolutionary Guards
headline.main: 48 Captives Are Iran ‘Thugs,’ Say Rebels in Syria
headline.print_headline: Iran ‘Thugs’ Are Held By Rebels In Syria
